      • getLogger

        public static org.apache.log4j.Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name)

        Retrieve a logger named according to the value of the name parameter. If the named logger already exists, then the existing instance will be returned. Otherwise, a new instance is created.

        By default, loggers do not have a set level but inherit it from their nearest ancestor with a set level. This is one of the central features of log4j.

        name The name of the logger to retrieve.

      • debug

        public void debug(java.lang.String message,
                  java.lang.Object o1,
                  java.lang.Object o2)

        Log a DEBUG level message.

        The debug method checks if this category is DEBUG enabled by comparing the level of this category with the DEBUG level.

        Note: Passing a Throwable to this method will print the name of the Throwable but no stack trace. To print a stack trace use the debug(String, Object, Object) method.

        message Message to be logged. o1 Object to be substituted in the message. o2 Second object that should be substituted in the message. A null should be passed in if second substitution is not required

      • fatal

        public void fatal(java.lang.Object message,
                  java.lang.Throwable t)

        Logs a message object with a FATAL level including the stack trace of the Throwable t passed as a parameter.

        This method checks to make sure if this category is FATAL enabled by comparing the level of this category with the FATAL level. If this category is FATAL enabled, then it converts the message object to a string by invoking the appropriate object renderer. It then proceeds to call the registered appenders in this category and also higher in the hierarchy depending on the value of the additivity flag.

        message Message to be logged. t Exception log, including the stack trace.
        Specified by:
        fatal in interface com.sterlingcommerce.woodstock.util.frame.log.base.ISCILogger
        Overrides:
        fatal in class org.apache.log4j.Category

      • debug

        public void debug(java.lang.Object message,
                  java.lang.Throwable t)

        Logs a message object with a DEBUG level including the stack trace of the Throwable t passed as a parameter.

        This method checks to make sure if this category is DEBUG enabled by comparing the level of this category with the DEBUG level. If this category is DEBUG enabled, then it converts the message object to a string by invoking the appropriate object renderer. It then proceeds to call the registered appenders in this category and also higher in the hierarchy depending on the value of the additivity flag.

        message Message to be logged. t Exception log, including the stack trace.
        Specified by:
        debug in interface com.sterlingcommerce.woodstock.util.frame.log.base.ISCILogger
        Overrides:
        debug in class org.apache.log4j.Category

      • error

        public void error(java.lang.Object message,
                  java.lang.Throwable t)

        Logs a message object with ERROR level including the stack trace of the Throwable t passed as parameter.

        This method upon invoking first checks if this category is ERROR enabled by comparing the level of this category with the ERROR level. If this category is error enabled, then it converts the message object passed as parameter to a string by invoking the appropriate object renderer. Then the method proceeds to call all the registered appenders in this category and also higher in the hierarchy depending on the value of the additivity flag.

        message The message object to log. t The exception to log including the stack trace.
        Specified by:
        error in interface com.sterlingcommerce.woodstock.util.frame.log.base.ISCILogger
        Overrides:
        error in class org.apache.log4j.Category

      • warn

        public void warn(java.lang.String tranId,
                 com.yantra.yfc.util.YFCException ex)

        Logs a warning for the provided transaction ID with an exception ex. This method is used when the error generated is not catastrophic and the system is able to proceed with default values. For example, if an item is fetched to get the dimensions. If the item is not configured and it is not mandatory for the operation a warning is thrown.

        tranId The transaction Id associated with warning message. ex The exception to log.

      • warn

        public void warn(java.lang.Object message,
                 java.lang.Throwable t)

        Logs a message object with WARN level including the stack trace of the Throwable t passed as parameter.

        This method upon invoking first checks if this category is ERROR enabled by comparing the level of this category with the WARN level. If this category is error enabled, then it converts the message object passed as parameter to a string by invoking the appropriate object renderer. Then the method proceeds to call all the registered appenders in this category and also higher in the hierarchy depending on the value of the additivity flag.

        message The message object to log. t The exception to log including the stack trace.
        Overrides:
        warn in class org.apache.log4j.Category

      • log

        public void log(java.lang.String errorCode,
                java.lang.Throwable t)

        Logs a localized message. This method calls the l17dlog method of log4j by passing the priority as ERROR level and the key as the errorCode. The error code is replaced by its localized version from the resource bundle.

        errorCode The error code of the message. t The exception to log including the stack trace. setResourceBundle

      • assertLog

        public void assertLog(boolean assertion,
                      java.lang.String msg)
        Overridden assert message. If assertion parameter is false, logs msg as an error statement. assertion Boolean condition to be evaluated. msg Message to be logged.
        Overrides:
        assertLog in class org.apache.log4j.Category

      • getCurrentLevel

        public java.lang.String getCurrentLevel()
        Returns the current root level. Level as a String.

      • setLogAll

        public void setLogAll(boolean b)
        Parameter that determines whether all log messages should be sent to the appenders.

        If true, any message at or above the current log level for this logger will be logged.

        If false (default), additional filtering based on the current context is performed.

      • logAll

        protected boolean logAll()
        Determine whether to log all messages at the current log level. true if this logger or any parent logger has the logAll parameter set, false otherwise.

        public void setResourceBundle(com.ibm.icu.util.UResourceBundle bundle)
        Sets the resource bundle to be used with localized logging methods. bundle The resource bundle for logging.

      • startXMLTrace

        public static void startXMLTrace()
        Turns on XML Tracing. Making a call to this method, enables the current thread to collect trace information with logging framework.

      • endXMLTrace

        public static void endXMLTrace()
        Turns off XML Tracing. Making a call to this method clears all trace information and also disables any further tracing until startXMLtrace method is called again.

      • getTraceXML

        public static YFCElement getTraceXML()
        Returns the trace of messages collected by a thread since the trace was started. It also implicitly ends the previously started trace and starts a new trace for the thread. The format of the trace XML is:

        <Trace DTDOccurence="ZeroOrOne" >
          <LogMessage DTDOccurence="ZeroOrMany" Message="" />
        <Trace>

      • xmltrace

        public void xmltrace(java.lang.String message)

        This method enables programs to record a trace of informative messages during the course of an execution. Making a call to getXMLTrace method provides access to these messages in the form of an XML. The XML returned by getXMLTrace method can be later published by the application programs for troubleshooting.

        The logging framework is only a collection of messages and do not log these messages implicitly to any log file. The logging framework will collect trace messages only if the startXMLTrace method is called prior to calling this method.

        message The message trace.

      • xmlTraceDetail

        public void xmlTraceDetail(java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.String value)
